Description: Limestone shabti of Penmennefer with incised detail: a striated curled lappet-wig, a modelled face with the eyes traced with black paint; a representation of a Ba-bird on the chest and parallel hands in relief holding a hoe and another implement; the leg section is inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of the Book of The Dead in a central column of incised Hieroglyphs and four rows giving chapter 6 from the Book of the Dead; the back is decorated with a representation of a seed-basket.
